meanings.definition: A process that is part of a larger process.
meanings.sent1: In the factory, the assembly line consists of many subprocesses.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the subprocesses of photosynthesis helps in learning about plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The little subprocesses in the big machine had a meeting to discuss efficiency.
meanings.sent4: Each team member is like a subprocess in the overall project, contributing to the final result.
meanings.sent5: The subprocesses in the computer program work together seamlessly to execute tasks.

meanings.definition: To divide a process into smaller parts.
meanings.sent1: It is important to subprocesses complex tasks for better management.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to subprocesses the recipe to make it easier for beginners.
meanings.sent3: I will subprocesses the project into manageable steps to avoid feeling overwhelmed.
meanings.sent4: She likes to subprocesses her work to stay organized and focused.
meanings.sent5: The teacher taught us how to subprocesses the assignment for better understanding.
